content.abs: Chris Cernich, a co-founder of a new advisory firm, said large investors did not want to wage war on public companies but did want a closer dialogue with them.
content.head: A New Strategy for Shareholder Activism: Engagement

content.abs: Concerned that agencies’ largely white and male leadership is hindering efforts to connect with American consumers, some companies threaten to walk.
content.head: Brands to Ad Agencies: Diversify or Else

content.abs: As more cities impose tax on sugary drinks, a vow from some soft drink producers to reduce calories 20 percent in 10 years advances ever so slightly.
content.head: Creeping Progress in Pledge to Cut Calories in Sugary Soda

content.abs: The election of Donald J. Trump is perhaps the starkest illustration yet that social networks are helping to rewire human society.
content.head: Social Media’s Globe-Shaking Power

content.abs: ZTO Express, delivery company that has become key player in China's huge e-commerce boom, raises unexpectedly high $1.4 billion in its initial public offering of stock; is largest American debut by a Chinese company since $25 billion stock sale by Alibaba Group in 2014.
content.head: ZTO Express of China Has Largest U.S. I.P.O. This Year

content.abs: Some are facing a backlash after remarks that appeared to oppose or support his election.
content.head: American Companies Tailor Responses to Trump Election

content.abs: Even if you thought you’d had enough of card-hopping, you might consider grabbing one of those eye-popping sign-up bonuses.
content.head: How to Pounce on Best Credit Card Offers (Before Banks Pull Them)

content.abs: Bank of America, MasterCard and some financial start-ups have been trying out chatbots that can initiate transactions and give financial advice.
content.head: Morning Agenda: Finance Gets Chatty, 2016’s Biggest American I.P.O., EpiPen Rival Returns, Commercials Just for You

content.abs: Country's largest patient advocacy groups have mostly avoided public debate over skyrocketing drug prices; many of these groups, which are hugely influence on Capitol Hill, get millions of dollars annually in donations from drug firms; critics say groups, by avoiding cost debate, are shirking patient-advocacy responsibilities.
content.head: Furor Over Drug Prices Puts Patient Advocacy Groups in Bind

content.abs: Drug company Kaleo announces it will bring back Auvi-Q, EpiPen alternative taken off market in 2015, in move cautiously welcomed by lawmakers concerned about rising price of EpiPens; it is unclear whether drug will help lower prices of epinephrine-delivery devices given fact that since it previously cost more than EpiPen and generic version is expected to be launched.
content.head: An EpiPen Rival Is About to Return to the Shelves
